results.title: Acupuncture
results.creator_credit: Lin Sheng-Lung, Weng Jeng-Yih and Keta Communications
results.brief_description: Acupuncture and moxibustion in China have recorded histories of several thousand years. They are effective, convenient and safe treatments. Many people regard both treatments as one and the same, but they are in fact two distinct treatments that are often used together. Acupuncture is a corrective therapy and moxibustion is the burning of herbs on acupuncture points to bring healing relief. This is a in-depth analysis of these two healing methods, how they are applied and their increasing acceptance as efficacious treatments in Western medicine.

results.title: Action-reaction
results.brief_description: A study of the changing approach to the teaching of physical education in Victorian secondary schools. Shows how the highly competitive and restrictive activities of cricket and football have been augmented by a wide range of both popular and unusual sports which allow the student to develop within his own capacity.

results.title: Acting class
results.creator_credit: John Smith, Roman Kroitor and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: For anyone who has ever wondered what it takes to become an actor, the film provides a close-up of a craft that demands much from body and mind. An energetic and intense film which looks in at students and instructors as they sweat and strain through a typical workday at the National Theatre School - Canada’s foremost training ground for performers.

results.title: Act of no choice
results.creator_credit: Mark Worth and Kino Eye Pictures
results.brief_description: This video tells the tragic story of West Papua through the eyes of Arie Van Klinken : a Dutch patrol officer in the 50s and 60s ; William Zongannau: a prominent West Papuan politician in the 1960s ; and Hugh Lunn: the only living journalist who witnessed the farcical ‘Act of Free Choice” for West Papua in 1969. Through access to secret documents, the film uncovers how Australia colluded with Indonesia to keep the so called “Act of Free Choice” a secret from the outside world. Contains Dutch home movies, newsreel footage and previously unseen film coverage of the “Act of Free Choice”. Music by David Bridie and Arthur Lyman.

results.title: Across Canada with Princess Elizabeth
results.brief_description: A memorable record of the 15,000 mile tour of Canada by Princess Elizabeth and the Duke of Edinburgh. Opening with the Royal couple’s tumultuous reception in Quebec, the film covers the full extent of the tour. Narrated by Bernard Braden and Barbera Kelly.

results.title: Achievement
results.creator_credit: Jean Halliday, Lex Halliday, Australian Instructional Films and Crusader Cloth Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: The story of the Australian wool industry. The success of this industry and its importance to the Australian economy is dependent on the work of many people; the sheep breedere, the boundary rider, the wool classer, the broker, and the skilled operatives converting fibre to cloth, all play their part.

results.title: Achieve with honor
results.brief_description: Sponsored by the Helms Athletic Foundation, this film gives a history of the Olympic Games, from the first Olympiad of the modern era at Athens in 1896 until the 11th Olympiad in Berlin in 1936. Presents and reiterates the notion that winning is less important than competing well but then, however, goes on to recount a list of victorious athletes from past Olympics. Narrated by Bill Henry.

results.title: Accidents will happen
results.creator_credit: Guy Richards, Fabienne Nicholas, Cinemedia and XYZ
results.brief_description: In an attempt to pay his son’s medical bills following an unfortunate accident, a father (Brett Swain) sends in handicam footage of Timmy’s mishap into the reality show, “Accidents will happen”. His wife (Anni Finsterer) is bitterly disappointed, but makes the journey into the studio with the family when they are in contention for a financial benefit. When the production crew discover the faux accident has resulted in Timmy becoming wheelchair bound, they send down an executive (Chris Haywood) to reneg the claim and all appears to be lost. A timely tale about reality television that featured as part of the St Kilda Film Festival and Touring Film Festival, 1999. Cast also includes Michael Barrallon, Emily Barr, Alan Dale and Tania Lacy.

results.title: Accessible city doctor Wilfred Owen
results.brief_description: Cities are growing at a calamitous pace and they will be unliveable unless the idea of accidental growth is abandoned in favour of planning. Dr. Wilfred Owen discusses some of the features essential to the functioning of a city for business by day and recreation by night, and the role of transportation in effecting the growth of cities for the benefit of people
